name: Breaking the Reward-Punishment Cycle
description: Disrupting the psychological conditioning that keeps people trapped in abusive emotional loops.

cards.title: Understanding the PSN Reinforcement System
cards.description: Breaking down the methods PSNs use to condition their victims.
bulletpoints: Identifying the cycle of love-bombing, devaluation, and discarding.
Recognizing when positive reinforcement is being used as a control mechanism.
Developing conscious resistance to intermittent validation tactics.
cards.summaryText: Spot the love-bomb, devalue, discard cycle, recognize when positive reinforcement is just a control tool, and develop conscious resistance to those intermittent validation hits.

cards.title: Disrupting the Emotional Reward System
cards.description: Replacing PSN-induced emotional highs and lows with balanced self-regulation.
bulletpoints: Using self-generated validation to reduce dependency on external emotional rewards.
Practicing emotional neutrality to prevent manipulation from guilt or flattery.
Rewiring dopamine responses to activate through self-driven activities rather than PSN interactions.
cards.summaryText: Generate your own validation to cut dependency on external rewards, practice emotional neutrality to block guilt or flattery manipulation, and rewire dopamine to fire from self-driven activities not PSN interactions.

cards.title: Rejecting Trauma-Based Conditioning
cards.description: Neutralizing the subconscious programming that PSNs instill through repetition and fear.
bulletpoints: Interrupting trauma loops through conscious redirection techniques.
Using meditation and breathing exercises to counteract emotional triggers.
Developing an autonomous mental framework that prevents external influence.
cards.summaryText: Interrupt trauma loops with conscious redirection, use meditation and breathing to counteract emotional triggers, and build an autonomous mental framework that blocks external influence.
